disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form provides information about the advantages and risks of laser treatment for onychomycosis (nail fungus). Read thoroughly and discuss with your practitioner before proceeding.

Take time to consider all options, seek second opinions, and ask questions. Laser therapy (Nd:YAG, CO2, or diode lasers) penetrates the nail plate to target fungal elements in the nail bed/matrix through photothermal/photomechanical effects, without damaging surrounding tissue. No numbing needed; sessions last 10-30 minutes per foot. Typically 3-12 treatments spaced 1-4 weeks apart; new clear nail growth visible in 3-12 months. Complete mycological cure not guaranteed (~60-80% clinical improvement); recurrence possible.

Keep nails trimmed short, feet dry, use antifungal powder post-treatment. Multiple sessions required; informed of practitioner each time, withdraw consent anytime.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common: mild warmth/discomfort during treatment, transient redness, swelling resolving within hours-days. Less common: temporary nail discoloration, pain, blistering, dry skin.

Rare: nail matrix damage (abnormal growth), burns, infection. Contraindications: photosensitive medications, active nail/skin infection, pregnancy/breastfeeding, melanoma history, pacemakers (some lasers), poor circulation.

I confirm understanding of procedure reasons, risks (including not treating), personal health risks, benefits, alternatives (oral/topical antifungals), uncertainties, follow-up care.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photos/videos for confidential records.

I certify reading/understanding this form, questions answered satisfactorily, and consent to procedure.

questions.content: Do you comprehend the details that have been given to you?
Do you believe enough information has been shared to allow you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent voluntarily?
Are there any health issues you currently have?
Are you currently pregnant or nursing a child?
Do you suffer from a neuromuscular disorder (such as Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune condition?
Do you experience any skin problems?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection at the area where the procedure is planned?
Are you currently on any antibiotics or other prescribed medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in detail.
What are your goals and desired results for undergoing this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you undergone this or a comparable treatment previously? If so, were there any issues? Please provide details.
Do you have any concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there anything else we need to know? Please provide full information.
I will keep this information for the duration of my treatment and consult it as needed.
